metadata.Title: CVE-2014-2906 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The psub function in fish (aka fish-shell) 1.16.0 before 2.1.1 does notproperly create temporary files, which allows local users to executearbitrary commands via a temporary file with a predictable name.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-2906` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

fish - 2.1.1-1
fish-common - 2.1.1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: fish package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-1').
